title: Riot have you ever thought to make single target spells draw minion aggro?
body:
I'm not talking skillshots or auto enhancers, I mean legit single target spells such as Vlad Q, Olaf E, Ryze E, Leblanc Q, etc..

What if these singlr target spells drew the same aggro as auto attacks? I think playing champs like Ryze can't just auto bully you to death with their spells while drawing 0 aggro.

replies.body: anyone else surprized Meddler commented on this one? didnt seem to big of a thing for him
Simpler questions like these are a lot easier to respond to then the weightier things.

Yup, simpler stuff can be responded to in small gaps during the day that just aren't useful for longer posts.

I also just really enjoy talking design principle/concepts like this as well though, even if balance/features tend to be the more popular topics.
Um... they do.
No they dont, whenever I play Olaf in lane and use E on my laner I draw no aggro
Then that's a bug. Damaging an enemy champion should always draw minion agro, unless I'm badly mistaken.

> [{quoted}](name=Icestar1186,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=faEEJdmr,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2016-05-18T02:35:45.877+0000)
>
> Then that's a bug. Damaging an enemy champion should always draw minion agro, unless I'm badly mistaken.

Same way as a tower, minions will have their bubble and if both champions who are fighting are not in it, or one isn't pushed further then the tower sided end of the circle, it won't draw agro.
That's wrong, minions only draw aggro on auto attacks. That's why you don't see mages being destroyed by minions when they use a spell to poke
nvm meddler responded
Ill try to make a video to show you that's not true. Gimme an hour, have no recording thingy to record it
Nope, it never has drawn aggro if it is a single target spell, its why Ryze, Vlad, and many more with single target spammable spells are such strong bullies.
Exactly, minions only draw aggro on auto attacks, or skills that are considered auto attacks (yasuo q, gp q)

> [{quoted}](name=Pyrithegethon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=faEEJdmr,comment-id=0002000000000001,timestamp=2016-05-18T02:40:05.140+0000)
>
> Nope, it never has drawn aggro if it is a single target spell, its why Ryze, Vlad, and many more with single target spammable spells are such strong bullies.

Read what I actually said, learn their bubbles, make sure BOTH champs are in range and towards the 2nd half of the enemies tower end or unless both are pushed way back and casters have no other targets in rage... Not a hard concept.

We've considered it, it's an enormous change to how a lot of lanes play out though, in terms of playstyle and game balance. Conclusion so far has been that the benefits don't outweigh the costs as a result. It also makes it a bit harder to understand what does and doesn't draw minion agro versus the current 'only basic attacks' rule, though as per some other discussion in this thread that's not always a clear rule even for experienced players.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=faEEJdmr,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-05-18T02:58:18.235+0000)
>
> that's not always a clear rule even for experienced players.

Maybe if you guys had an actual tutorial... Or even a game-info site that works so we don't have to rely on a wiki....
Do you think it would make balancing champs in top lane easier(Ryze, Vlad, etc.) as they can now be punished for using spells on the enemy laner and actually face retaliation?

It'd certainly change up how we have to approach balancing any lane, helping in some cases like that. It would likely empower ranged auto attackers (Kennen, Jayce, Kayle, Quinn etc) who are already decent choices top though too. They're presently kept somewhat in check by the way their harass draws agro, whereas some of the tools others have to respond to them don't, instead having mana and/or CD costs of note.
